all_questions.question: What was one of the children's favourite games when they didn't have toys?
Why were the adults chopping down street trees in Berlin, according to the narrator?
all_questions.context: They sawed them up. They had something to burn.

all_questions.question: What was a common way for children to make toys when they didn't have any?
all_questions.context: Something was made out of some scraps.

all_questions.question: Why did the children in American schools collecting toys for German children mark an end to their own toy-making activities?
all_questions.context: Toys that we had never seen before came in small boxes. Suddenly there were real dolls.

all_questions.question: What was the narrator's attitude towards finding something valuable in the rubble, according to their description?
all_questions.context: If you found a crate like that, for example, some of the boys or their fathers or mothers would build little trolleys out of it.
